Prepare yourself with these tips to be a successful voter

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Election day is November 6. Polls will be open from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. unless otherwise noted.

There is a lot at stake in this year's general election and we want to make sure that you are as prepared as possible to exercise your voting rights at the polls.

Here are a few things to remember.

November 2 is the last day for in-person early voting at your absentee ballot location. Find your absentee ballot location by contacting your county clerk. A list of county clerks can be found on the Idaho Secretary of State voting website.

  • Check your voter registration status.
  • Locate your polling place and note hours of operation.
  • Consider voting early or by absentee if possible.
  • If possible, get to the polls early on Election Day to avoid the last minute rush.
  • If registering on the day of the election, you need to show an accepted form of identification. You will not be able to use the Personal Identification Affidavit.
  • If you have registered prior to Election Day, you can show accepted Identification or sign the Personal Identification Affidavit.

Register in-person at your polling place on Election Day:

  1. Complete a registration card.
  2. Provide proof of residency that contains a valid address that matches the address used on your voter registration application.
  3. Provide a photo I.D. card. You cannot sign the Personal Identification Affidavit in lieu of photo I.D. when you register in person on the day of the election.

Idaho's accepted forms of identification:

  • Idaho driver's license or an Idaho identification card issued by the Department of Transportation.
  • U.S. passport or Federal Identification card.
  • A tribal photo identification card.
  • A current student photo I.D., issued by an Idaho high school or post-secondary education institution.
  • A license to carry a concealed weapon issued by a county sheriff in Idaho.

Documents accepted to show residency:

  • A valid Idaho driver's license issued through the Department of Transportation.
  • A valid Idaho identification card issued through the Department of Transportation.
  • Any document which contains a valid address in the county you reside, together with a photo identification card.
  • Students may use a valid student identification card from their university or college in Idaho combined with a current student fee statement that contains the student's valid address in the county with a picture identification card.

Find all our voting rights materials, including specific voting info on transgender voting rights, voting with a criminal conviction, and voting for individuals experiencing homelessness on the ACLU of Idaho website.

Know Your Rights

Thanks for standing with us,

Ruby Mendez
Advocacy Fellow, ACLU of Idaho
